title: Paul Ince offers worrying prediction for where Man Utd will finish under Solskjaer
text:
Solskjaer is under pressure (Picture: Getty)

Paul Ince is concerned that Manchester United are showing no signs of improvement under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and offered a worrying prediction that the Red Devils could finish in the bottom half of the Premier League.

The former United and Liverpool midfielder hasn’t been able to figure out exactly what Solskjaer is trying to implement at Old Trafford and pointed to Frank Lampard as an example of getting results from his young Chelsea players with an attacking style of play.

And Ince fears the lack of direction could see Manchester United – who are sat just two points above the relegation zone – finish in the bottom half of the table.

Paul Ince is not convinced by Solskjaer’s methods (Picture: AMA/Getty Images)

He told TalkSport: ‘We know Ole is going to get criticised and will come under pressure because he’s not getting results, but also because we’re not getting any signs that it’s going to improve.

‘Obviously with young players it’s going to take time, but Chelsea have got young players and they’re doing alright. Liverpool have got two young full-backs they’re doing ok.

‘They could finish in the bottom half of the table. When I’m seeing Ole after the games saying, “we’re working hard, we’re working hard”, I keep thinking we just want to see what they’re actually working on.

‘When I see the team I don’t see what they’re doing. I don’t see their patterns of play and I don’t see how they’re working from an attacking point of view, because they’re not creating chances – they’re not even having any shots.

‘I just don’t know what they’re actually doing at Manchester United.’

Solskjaer’s side welcome table toppers Liverpool to Old Trafford this weekend, with Jurgen Klopp’s team trying to win their 18th consecutive league match and equal Manchester City’s record of successive wins.
